q: What preparation is required before flood barrier installation?
a:
Openings must be clean, level, and structurally sound. We laser-measure thresholds, check slab slope tolerance (≤3 mm), and verify substrate compressive strength above 2,500 psi. A smooth surface ensures gasket compression to ASTM E330 standards.

See also door-threshold preparation and Miami flood-barrier services.

q: How long does a full-house installation take?
a: Typical 3–5 opening homes complete within one working day. Complex perimeters or multiple garage spans may require 2–3 days. Panels are prefabricated from CAD scans to reduce onsite fabrication time.

q: Are flood barrier tracks permanently fixed?
a: Yes. Aluminum side channels anchor with 316 SS bolts and marine-grade epoxy. Tracks remain low-profile year-round and are paintable for aesthetics. Removable clamps are available for heritage façades.

Most jurisdictions classify flood barriers as dry-floodproofing devices. Permanent anchoring needs a minor permit; removable panels generally do not. We file through ePermitting for each city (Clearwater flood barriers, Naples, etc.).

q: What is included in the installation package?
a: Engineering drawings, material certification, site prep, anchor setting, panel fitting, and homeowner demonstration. Optional pressure-test certification available upon request.

q: Can barriers be installed on uneven driveways?
a: Yes. We shim or grind within 3 mm tolerance and use compressive EPDM gaskets to close gaps. For slopes exceeding 1 inch per 4 ft, we fabricate tapered panels.

q: How do you ensure watertight performance after installation?
a: Every completed system undergoes a static water test for 15 minutes to verify seal continuity. Results are documented for insurance compliance.
Clients receive a maintenance manual, torque schedule, and direct technician line. Annual inspection renewals extend the 10-year structural warranty.
